Posted By: durdent (1/8/2010 9:38:41 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Definitely a good card. Unless you're playing white you're going to have trouble getting rid of him permanently. 2 damage may not seem like much, but when it comes out as early as turn 2 and can just keep on coming, it's pretty dandy. Also works really well with other cards like Quest for the Gravelord and Blade of the Bloodchief, as well as fodder for the opponent playing something like a kicked Gatekeeper. It even works as great discard fodder, as you can effectively get a free cast of it by playing a land.
posts.html:
Definitely a good card. Unless you're playing white you're going to have trouble getting rid of him permanently. 2 damage may not seem like much, but when it comes out as early as turn 2 and can just keep on coming, it's pretty dandy. Also works really well with other cards like Quest for the Gravelord and Blade of the Bloodchief, as well as fodder for the opponent playing something like a kicked Gatekeeper. It even works as great discard fodder, as you can effectively get a free cast of it by playing a land.

Posted By: JaxsonBateman (12/3/2009 9:16:46 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This guy is sooo nice, getting to play a creature over and over again by just playing lands is wicked. You can either have him with just swamp in your standard vamp deck, or you can use fetchlands for extra many reanimations. He syncs so well with vicera, kalastria highborne, blood throne, and the fact that he is 2/1 means he isn't broken, unlike some green vine guy. Cpativating makes you able to swing with a 3/2, and basilisk collar was simply made for this guy. Shame the price has gone up, but not strange.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
I hate that this card exists, and that they made it so strong. This card being $10+ means my "sacrifice creatures" decks will always be missing something.
  
   
And this is why I never bought [Demon of Death's Gate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demon of Death's Gate), [Kalastia Highborn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kalastia Highborn), or made a serious [Vampire Aristocrat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Aristocrat) deck. Why make a deck when you can't use the best cards available?
